intro: Eleocharis caduca, commonly known as the annual spikerush, is a flowering plant native to wetland environments in North America. It is a member of the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and other grass-like plants. The plant typically grows in shallow water or moist soil, forming dense clusters of slender, grass-like stems. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are arranged in spikelets, and it produces lightweight seeds that are dispersed by wind. Eleocharis caduca plays a role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various aquatic organisms.
